com.nttdocomo.ui
Class Label

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.nttdocomo.ui.Component
        |
        +--com.nttdocomo.ui.Label
public final class Label
extends Component

This defines the component that displays texts. Label class is one of the UI components used in high level API and a component for displaying character strings. It only supports single-line text display. When displaying of text in multiple lines is desired, set the TextBox to not editable.

When the alignment is designated, the text is displayed as below. When nothing is designated, the alignment is Label.CENTER. 

 When alignment is Label.RIGHT
      +----------------------+
      |                 ABCDE|
      +----------------------+
 
 When alignment is Label.CENTER
      +----------------------+
      |        ABCDE         |
      +----------------------+
 
 When alignment is Label.LEFT
      +----------------------+
      |ABCDE                 |
      +----------------------+
When the size is not designated, the component size is the smallest size in which the set label character string can be stored. However, when the width is longer than the screen width, the width is the same as the screen width.
When text cannot fit in the component size, the excess text is disposed of and the text displayed.

Constructor Detail

Label

public Label()
This creates a label with an empty ("") character string. When created, it is visible. To set visible or invisible, the setVisible method is used.
This is recognized as having alignment set to centered.

Label

public Label(java.lang.String text)
This creates a label by designating the label character string. When created, it is visible. To set visible or invisible, the setVisible method is used.
This is recognized as having alignment set to centered.

Parameters:
text - Designates the label character string. When null is designated, an empty character string ("") is set.

Label

public Label(java.lang.String text,
             int alignment)
This creates a label by designating the label character string and alignment. When created, it is visible. To set visible or invisible, the setVisible method is used.

Parameters:
text - Designates the label character string. When null is designated, an empty character string ("") is set.
alignment - Designates the alignment.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when an illegal value is set for the argument alignment.
Method Detail

setText

public void setText(java.lang.String text)
This sets the label character string of a component.

Parameters:
text - This designates the label character string. When null is designated, an empty character string ("") is set.

setAlignment

public void setAlignment(int alignment)
This sets the alignment of label character string. The actual method of display is implementation dependent.

Parameters:
alignment - Designates the alignment.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when an illegal value is designated for the argument alignment.
